name: Fried Chicken
cooking_method: In a large bowl, soak chicken pieces in buttermilk for at least 1 hour or overnight in the refrigerator.
In a separate bowl, combine flour, salt, black pepper, paprika, and cayenne pepper.
Dredge chicken pieces in flour mixture, shaking off any excess.
Heat oil in a large skillet or deep fryer to 350°F.
Fry chicken in batches until golden brown and cooked through, about 15 minutes.
Transfer fried chicken to a wire rack to drain excess oil.
Serve hot or cold.

name: Mac and Cheese
cooking_method: Cook macaroni according to package instructions.
In a separate pot, melt butter over medium heat.
Whisk in flour until smooth and bubbly.
Gradually whisk in milk, salt, black pepper, garlic powder, and onion powder.
Cook, stirring constantly, until sauce thickens and bubbles.
Reduce heat to low and stir in shredded cheddar cheese until melted and smooth.
Drain macaroni and stir into cheese sauce.
Serve hot.

name: BBQ Ribs
cooking_method: Preheat oven to 275°F.
Remove the silver skin from the back of each rack of ribs.
In a small bowl, mix together brown sugar, smoked paprika, garlic powder, onion powder, salt, and black pepper.
Rub spice mixture over both sides of ribs.
Wrap each rack of ribs tightly in aluminum foil.
Bake ribs in the oven for 3 hours.
Remove ribs from foil and brush with BBQ sauce.
Grill ribs over high heat until caramelized and slightly charred, about 2-3 minutes per side.
Serve hot with additional BBQ sauce.

name: Collard Greens
ingredients: 1 bunch collard greens, washed and chopped
cooking_method: In a large pot, cook the bacon over medium heat until crispy.
Add the onion and garlic to the pot and sauté until the onion is translucent.
Add the collard greens to the pot and stir until they are coated with the bacon fat.
Add the chicken broth, apple cider vinegar, salt, black pepper, and red pepper flakes to the pot.
Cover the pot and simmer for 30-40 minutes, or until the collard greens are tender.
Adjust seasoning as needed and serve hot.

name: Buffalo Chicken Wings
ingredients: Ranch or blue cheese dressing, for serving
cooking_method: Preheat oven to 400°F.
In a large bowl, mix together flour, cayenne pepper, garlic powder, and salt.
Add chicken wings to the bowl and toss to coat.
Arrange the chicken wings in a single layer on a baking sheet and bake for 45 minutes, flipping the wings halfway through.
While the chicken wings are baking, melt the butter in a small saucepan over medium heat.
Add hot sauce, honey, and apple cider vinegar to the saucepan and stir to combine.
When the chicken wings are done, remove them from the oven and toss them in the hot sauce mixture.
Serve hot with ranch or blue cheese dressing.

name: Philly Cheesesteak
cooking_method: Preheat a cast iron skillet over medium-high heat.
Add sliced onions and green peppers to the skillet and sauté until tender.
Remove the onions and green peppers from the skillet and set aside.
Add the thinly sliced ribeye steak to the same skillet and season with salt and pepper.
Cook the steak for 2-3 minutes or until browned.
Add the sautéed onions and green peppers back into the skillet with the steak and mix well.
Place a slice of American cheese on top of the steak and vegetables mixture, and let it melt.
Using a spatula, transfer the steak and cheese mixture to a hoagie roll.
Repeat with the remaining rolls and steak mixture.
Serve hot.

name: Southern Fried Chicken
cooking_method: Place the chicken pieces in a large bowl and pour the buttermilk over them.
Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight.
In a separate large bowl, whisk together the flour, paprika, garlic powder, onion powder, cayenne pepper, salt, and black pepper.
Remove the chicken from the buttermilk and let the excess buttermilk drip off.
Dredge the chicken pieces in the flour mixture, pressing the flour mixture onto the chicken to coat well.
In a large skillet or Dutch oven, heat about 2 inches of vegetable oil over medium-high heat to 350°F.
Working in batches, add the chicken to the hot oil and fry until golden brown and crispy, turning occasionally, about 15-20 minutes.
Remove the chicken from the oil and place it on a wire rack to drain.
Serve hot.

name: New England Clam Chowder
ingredients: 1 pound Yukon Gold potatoes, peeled and diced
3 cans (6.5 ounces each) chopped clams, drained
cooking_method: In a large pot, cook the bacon over medium heat until crispy.
Remove the bacon with a slotted spoon and set aside on a paper towel-lined plate.
Add the onion and celery to the pot and cook until tender, stirring occasionally.
Add the flour to the pot and stir to combine.
Gradually add the clam juice and half-and-half, stirring constantly.
Add the bay leaf, thyme, and potatoes to the pot and bring to a simmer.
Simmer until the potatoes are tender, about 20-25 minutes.
Add the clams to the pot and cook for 5 minutes more.
Season with salt and pepper, to taste.
Ladle the chowder into bowls and sprinkle with the crispy bacon and chopped parsley.
Serve hot.

name: Cornbread
cooking_method: Preheat the oven to 400°F.
In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, cornmeal, sugar, baking powder, and salt.
In a separate bowl, whisk together the milk, eggs, and vegetable oil.
Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients and stir until just combined.
Pour the batter into a greased 8-inch square baking pan.
Bake for 20-25 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
Remove from the oven and let cool for a few minutes before slicing and serving.

name: Chili
ingredients: 1 can (15 ounces) kidney beans, drained and rinsed
1 can (15 ounces) black beans, drained and rinsed
Sour cream and shredded cheddar cheese, for garnish
cooking_method: In a large pot or Dutch oven, cook the ground beef over medium heat until browned, breaking it up into small pieces with a spoon.
Add the onion, garlic, and red bell pepper to the pot and cook until the vegetables are tender.
Add the kidney beans, black beans, diced tomatoes, tomato sauce, chili powder, cumin, salt, black pepper, cayenne pepper, paprika, and water to the pot.
Bring the chili to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for 30-45 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Serve hot, garnished with sour cream and shredded cheddar cheese.

name: Meatloaf
cooking_method: Preheat the oven to 350°F.
In a large bowl, mix together the ground beef, onion, garlic, breadcrumbs, eggs, milk, ketchup, Worcestershire sauce, Dijon mustard, salt, black pepper, parsley, thyme, and rosemary.
Shape the mixture into a loaf and place it in a baking dish.
Bake for 1 hour or until the internal temperature reaches 160°F.
Remove the meatloaf from the oven and let it rest for 10 minutes before slicing and serving.

name: Fried Catfish
cooking_method: In a large bowl, mix together the cornmeal, flour, garlic powder, paprika, salt, and cayenne pepper.
Pour the buttermilk into a separate bowl.
Dip each catfish fillet into the buttermilk, then dredge it in the cornmeal mixture, shaking off any excess.
Heat the oil in a deep frying pan over medium-high heat.
Add the catfish fillets to the pan and fry until golden brown, about 3-4 minutes per side.
Remove the catfish fillets from the pan with a slotted spoon and place them on a paper towel-lined plate to drain any excess oil.
Serve hot with your favorite dipping sauce.

name: Biscuits and Gravy
cooking_method: In a large skillet over medium-high heat, cook the breakfast sausage until browned and crumbled.
Sprinkle the flour over the sausage and stir until well combined.
Gradually stir in the milk, salt, and black pepper, stirring constantly until the mixture thickens, about 5-7 minutes.
Reduce the heat to low and simmer the gravy for 2-3 minutes.
Split the biscuits in half and place them on plates.
Ladle the sausage gravy over the biscuits.
Serve hot and enjoy!

name: Jambalaya
ingredients: 1 pound boneless, skinless chicken thighs, cut into bite-size pieces
Salt and black pepper, to taste
cooking_method: In a large Dutch oven over medium heat, cook the andouille sausage until browned, about 5-7 minutes.
Add the chicken to the pot and cook until browned, about 5 minutes.
Add the onion, bell pepper, celery, and garlic to the pot and cook until softened, about 5-7 minutes.
Add the diced tomatoes, Cajun seasoning, paprika, thyme, oregano, and cayenne pepper to the pot and stir until well combined.
Pour in the chicken broth and bring the mixture to a simmer.
Add the rice to the pot and stir until well combined.
Cover the pot and simmer until the rice is tender and the liquid is absorbed, about 20-25 minutes.
Season with salt and black pepper, to taste.
Garnish with chopped green onions before serving.

name: Pulled Pork
ingredients: 5-6 pound pork shoulder or Boston butt roast
1/2 cup barbecue sauce, plus more for serving
cooking_method: In a small bowl, whisk together the smoked paprika, garlic powder, onion powder, brown sugar, salt, black pepper, and cayenne pepper.
Rub the spice mixture all over the pork shoulder, making sure to cover the entire surface.
Place the pork shoulder in a slow cooker and pour in the chicken broth and apple cider vinegar.
Cover the slow cooker and cook on low for 8-10 hours, or until the pork is very tender and falls apart easily with a fork.
Remove the pork from the slow cooker and transfer it to a cutting board.
Using two forks, shred the pork into bite-size pieces.
Stir in the barbecue sauce until the pork is coated and heated through.
Serve the pulled pork with additional barbecue sauce and your favorite sides, such as coleslaw and cornbread.

name: Potato Salad
cooking_method: Boil the potatoes until they are fork-tender, then let them cool slightly before chopping into bite-sized pieces.
In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the mayonnaise, sour cream, pickle relish, Dijon mustard, garlic powder, onion powder, paprika, salt, and pepper.
Add the chopped potatoes, chopped eggs, chopped celery, chopped red onion, and chopped parsley to the mixing bowl and stir until everything is evenly coated in the dressing.
Refrigerate the potato salad for at least an hour before serving to allow the flavors to meld together.

name: Gumbo
ingredients: 1 lb boneless skinless chicken thighs, cut into bite-sized pieces
Chopped green onions and parsley for garnish
cooking_method: In a large pot, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat.
Add the flour and stir continuously until it turns a deep brown color, about 20-25 minutes.
Add the diced onion, green bell pepper, celery, and garlic to the pot and cook for 5-7 minutes until the vegetables are softened.
Add the sliced andouille sausage and chicken to the pot and cook for another 5-7 minutes until the chicken is browned.
Pour in the chicken broth and diced tomatoes, then add the Cajun seasoning, Worcestershire sauce, and hot sauce. Stir everything together and bring to a simmer.
Let the gumbo simmer for 30-40 minutes until the flavors have melded together.
Add the shrimp to the pot and cook for another 5-7 minutes until they are pink and cooked through.
Season the gumbo with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve the gumbo over cooked white rice and garnish with chopped green onions and parsley.

name: Sloppy Joes
method: In a large skillet, cook the ground beef over medium heat until browned, stirring occasionally to break up the meat.
Add the onion and green bell pepper to the skillet and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add the ketchup, water, brown sugar, Worcestershire sauce, red wine vinegar, garlic powder, salt, and black pepper to the skillet and stir to combine.
Bring the mixture to a simmer and cook until thickened, about 10-15 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Serve the Sloppy Joes on hamburger buns.

name: Fried Green Tomatoes
method: Slice the tomatoes about 1/4-inch thick and discard the ends.
In a shallow bowl, mix together the flour, salt, black pepper, and cayenne pepper.
In another shallow bowl, whisk together the buttermilk and eggs.
In a third shallow bowl, mix together the panko bread crumbs and cornmeal.

Dip the tomato slices into the flour mixture, shaking off any excess, then dip them into the buttermilk mixture, and finally coat them in the panko bread crumb mixture, pressing the crumbs onto the tomatoes to adhere.
In a large skillet, heat enough vegetable oil to come about 1/2-inch up the sides of the skillet over medium-high heat.
Working in batches, fry the tomato slices until golden brown on both sides, about 2-3 minutes per side.
Drain the fried green tomatoes on paper towels and serve hot.

name: Mustard Greens
ingredients: 1 bunch mustard greens, washed and chopped
cooking_method: Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add the onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add the garlic and red pepper flakes and cook for 1 minute.
Add the mustard greens and broth to the skillet.
Season with salt and pepper.
Cook until the greens are wilted and tender, about 10-15 minutes.
Serve hot.
